page.title: 06 THE PANNIER MARKET
page.content: The market is set high near the Town centre. In the Pannier Market are the sounds of bustling{crowds}shopping, selling and chatting. People come from a 20 to 30 mile radius from Tavistock, Liskeard, Plymouth, Holsworthy, Bodmin and Okehampton.It is a{colourful}scene with rows of swinging clothes and piles of fruit and vegetables.The clothes were made in Italy, France, U.S.A.,Spain, Korea and Hong Kong.The {seasonal goods}like bedding plants, spring cabbage, strawberies, cherries and onions were mostly grown locally. Other{stalls}sell fabrics,sweets,fish, bric_a_brac,jewellery,china,tools, wool,dairy produce,toys,books and ice cream.The fish comes from Plymouth and much of the fruit from the Tamar Valley.The buisiest stall is the green grocer's because people in town do not grow enough vegetables for daily use.
